Dear Karl: 
Dear Karl: Thank you for your interest for my proposal of the c=
ometary impacts into ocean. My intenton is to=C2=A0 explore a possibility t=
hat some enormous comets of the early Earth period period with an appropria=
te energy/mass could create considerable amounts of free molecular oxygen (=
O2). This oxygen was generated through the thermal dissociation of cometary=
 H2O vapour with subsequent escape of hydrogen into interplanetary space. I=
n my previous report ( Premovi=C4=87, P.I. (2003) Cometary impacts into oce=
an: Thermochemical equilibrium calculations of high-temperature O2 generati=
on on the early Earth. International Journal of Impact Engineering 29, 575-=
587.)=C2=A0
=C2=A0I performed thermochemical equilibrium calculations at di=
fferent temperatures (from 1500 K up to 6000 K) and different pressures (fr=
om 1 mbar up to 270 bar) using the Gibbs-free-energy- minimization method (=
the STANJAN method) and JANAF thermochemical tables (the Chemkin collection=
s=C3=A2). Then, I simply extrapolate my conclusions for temperatures higher=
 than 6000 K but I was not happy with this.=C2=A0I wish now with someone=C2=
=A0to make thermochemical calculations for temperatures =C2=A0higher=C2=A0u=
p to 20,000 K, if it is possible at all.=C2=A0
At the moment I am on vacati=
on in Greece so I am not able to send to you a copy of this report. On the =
end of July I will be back in my Lab and I would you send this copy.
Lookin=
g for your reply.
Best regards,
Pavle=C2=A0=C2=A0

Pavle I. Premovic
Labora=
tory for Geochemistry,Cosmochemistry&Astrochemistry
University of Nis, P. O=
. Box 91,
18000 Nis, Serbia

--- In=C2=A0cantera@yahoogroups .com, "asteroid_2000_ 2000" <asteroid_2=
000_ 2000@...> wrote:
>
> Dear colleagues: I am a geochemist who has been w=
orking for last several years on the thermochemisty of cometary impacts int=
o ocean. I published even a paper related to this subject in respected Jour=
nal of the Impact Engineering. Theoretical calculations in this report was =
carried out using the Chemkin Collections=C2=AE and the STANJAN method equi=
librium calculations. I wish now to improve these calculations. I wonder if=
 someone in the Cantera Yahoo groups is interested to work with me (as a co=
author) on this project.
> Pavle I. Premovic
>
dear pavle
let me know what =
you want to do using cantera
manoj=C2=A0
